alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 18 at 6:01AM CDT until March 18 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT FOR WEBSTER...WRIGHT AND DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 601 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Marshfield to near Seymour to Ava, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marshfield... Ava... Seymour... Mansfield... Norwood... Hartville... Niangua... Duncan... Diggins... Brushyknob... Grovespring... Northview... Gentryville... Rome... Vanzant... Squires... Goodhope... Drury... Odin... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 93 and 100. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
